newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-RUSSELL NOT TO BE PUNISHED OVER HIS BOOK.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RUSSELL NOT TO BE PUNISHED OVER HIS BOOK.

text.p: England wicketkeeper Jack Russell is not to be punished by his country's cricket authorities over the publication of his forthcoming controversial autobiography.
Russell upset the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) by refusing to make any changes to the text ahead of a serialisation in a British newspaper this week and publication of the book on May 19.
The book contains criticism of former chairman of selectors Ray Illingworth and current England captain Mike Atherton, but is also considered fair comment from a respected Gloucestershire player.
However, after referral to ECB discipline committee chairman Gerard Elias QC, the authorities have clearly opted to let the matter rest in a bid to dissolve the furore surrounding the book.

Elias said in a statement on Friday: "Jack Russell had provided the Board with a copy of his book in March, albeit at a late stage before proposed publication, and in the circumstances the Board is not disposed to take any action over the question of the application for prior approval of the text.
"In relation to these extracts actually published I have no present intention of recommending that any disciplinary proceedings be taken."
